page.title: 01Parish of St Marys
page.content: Undulating farmland, mainly intensively managed as grassland for cattle raising. Much marginal land recently drained with grant aid from E.E.C. and brought under the plough. Secondary farming of sheep, but no dairying. Residual crofting still carried on, and inshore fishing (lobsters) pursued as a supplementary activity. Passenger ferry from Burwick to John O'Groats (summer only) established in recent years, and year-round ro-ro ferry service to Gills Bay planned to start within two years. The lands of Liddle Farm contain two important archeological sites recently excavated, with a small private museum which tourists visit. No public transport services exist on land except buses in connection with schools and the summer ferry. Landscape treeless and windswept,
